definition: A professional performer who specializes in executing daring and often dangerous physical feats, typically in the context of film, television, or live performances. This term is commonly employed to describe an individual who acts as a substitute for an actor during scenes involving risky actions or stunts, ensuring the safety of the main cast while creating an illusion of danger.

examples.english: The stuntman jumps off a building.
